result.story: The Cape Cod is probably named after the Massachusetts peninsula because they actually grow cranberries there (and the drink contains, well, loads of cranberry juice). But the drink also shares some features with the East-Northern outpost -- the true New Englander knows how to time it for just when the reds match.

result.story: The Clover Club once was a gentleman's hangout in Philadelphia, and records show that a drink with the same name was known already at the beginning of the 1900s. But on the other side of Prohibition (1920--1933) the Clover Club seems to have been almost forgotten. Today, it's been rediscovered, but our version holds vodka instead of the original gin.

result.story: The perfect way to make an Old-Fashioned has been disputed, but one thing is clear. Never was it more needed then during prohibition; it's the best way ever invented to improve the taste of bad liquor. Now made with the purest of ingredients, it's a helluva classy drink. Traditionally bourbon-based, it's something new with ABSOLUT.

result.story:
Making home-made flavored syrups is actually really easy, and a great way to create unique flavor combinations.

STRAWBERRY AND BLACK PEPPERCORN SYRUP

1 cup caster sugar
½ cup water
20 washed, hulled and halved ripe strawberries
1 tablespoon crushed black peppercorns

Let all ingredients simmer in a pan for 15 minutes, cool off and sieve into a bottle. Keeps for up to two weeks in the fridge.

ingredients.textPlain: 1 Part Strawberry and Black Peppercorn Syrup

result.story:
Making home-made flavored syrups is actually really easy, and a great way to create unique flavor combinations.

PEACH AND CARAWAY SYRUP RECIPE

4 ripe, fresh peaches (stoned and quartered)
1 cup caster sugar
1 teaspoon caraway seed
½ cup water

Let all ingredients simmer in a pan for 15 minutes, cool off and sieve into a bottle. Keeps for up to two weeks in the fridge.

result.story: ABSOLUT RUBY RED was introduced in 2006, just a few years after the success with the other citrus flavored members of the family ABSOLUT CITRON and ABSOLUT MANDRIN. The name ABSOLUT RUBY RED is taken from a special kind of red grapefruit. And grapefruit is of course what it tastes like! It is made exclusively from natural ingredients, and unlike most other flavored vodkas, it doesn’t contain any added sugar. ABSOLUT RUBY RED is smooth and fruity with a crisp and refreshing character of zesty grapefruit.

result.story: During World War 1, the Americans invented this drink to give champagne an extra kick. French 75 is named after the Howitzer artillery, said to be what really won the war. From the original recipe, we substitute gin for vodka and add it up to 76. Just as tasty and easy to mix.
